docs.text:
VPN/Proxy Client Config Instruction


This manual lists how to use each VPN or proxy on major Operating Systems: Windows, iOS, OSX, Android, Linux.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: This manual lists how to use each VPN or proxy on major Operating Systems: Windows, iOS, OSX, Android, Linux.
docs.title: VPN/Proxy Client Config Instruction

docs.text:
Shadowsocks






Platforms


Windows


OS X


Linux


Android


iOS










Windows


Method 1:




Download 
Shadowsocks for Windows
.


Extract the archive, and double-click on the Shadowsocks.exe file.


Make sure the QR code below is centered and completely visible, right-click on the Shadowsocks system tray icon, and go to 
Servers
 
 
Scan QRCode from Screen...






Method 2:




You may also go to 
Servers
 
 
New server
 and manually complete the following steps:


Enter 
178.62.33.140
 as the 
Server IP
.


Enter 
8388
 as the 
Server Port
.


Enter 
OpTBYD82WQzm29TZPgfJqA==
 as the 
Password
.


The 
Local Port
 should be 
1080
 and the 
Encryption Method
 should be 
aes-256-cfb
.


Click 
Save
.






Click on the Shadowsocks menu tray icon and select 
Enable
.


That's it! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






OS X


Method 1:




Download 
ShadowsocksX
.


Double-click the DMG, and drag the icon into your Applications folder.


Launch ShadowsocksX. You will be prompted to enter your password so that your system proxy settings can be modified.


Look for the Shadowsocks paper plane icon in your menu bar and click on it.


Make sure the QR code below is centered and completely visible, and choose 
Scan QR Code from Screen...






Method 2:




You may also configure the connection by going to 
Servers
, selecting 
Open Server Preferences...
, and clicking the 
+
 button on the sidebar:


Enter 
178.62.33.140
 and 
8388
 in the 
Address
 fields.


Make sure 
aes-256-cfb
 is selected for the 
Encryption
 value.


Enter 
OpTBYD82WQzm29TZPgfJqA==
 as the 
Password
.


Click 
OK
.






Click on the Shadowsocks icon in the menu bar again, and choose 
Global Mode
.


You can use the Shadowsocks icon to enable/disable the VPN. The color of the icon will change based on whether or not it is active.


That's it! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






Linux




Download the latest Shadowsocks 
linux clients
 for different Linux distributions.


From the command line, run 
ss-qt5




Click 
Connection
, select 
Add
, and you can:




Make sure the QR code below is centered and completely visible, click on 
Scan QR Code on Screnn










Or Choose 
Manually
, then fill in the configuration information as follows:




Server: 
178.62.33.140


Port: 
8388


Password: 
OpTBYD82WQzm29TZPgfJqA==


Encryption Method: 
aes-256-cfb












Once you have Shadowsocks running locally, you'll need to forward your browser traffic through the SOCKS proxy it provides.






Configuring Firefox to connect through a SOCKS proxy




Click the 
Menu
 button next to the 
Home
 icon to the right of the address bar.


Click 
Options
.


Click the 
Advanced
 icon.


Go to the 
Network
 tab.


Click the 
Settings
 button to 
Configure how Firefox connects to the Internet
.


Choose 
Manual proxy configuration
.


Enter 
127.0.0.1
 and Port 
1080
 on the 
SOCKS Host
 line.


Select 
Remote DNS
. This configures Firefox to send all DNS requests through the SOCKS proxy. This will protect you against DNS poisoning and ensure that false DNS entries cannot be used to censor your access.


Click 
OK
.


Click 
OK
 again to close the Firefox preferences window.


You should be good to go! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






Android




Download Shadowsocks for Android from 
Google Play
. If Google Play is blocked in your country, you can download a 
latest release apk file
 from Github.


Launch the application.


Tap the Shadowsocks icon in the top-left of the screen.


Tap the 
+
 icon in the bottom-right.


Select 
Scan QR code
.


Use your phone to scan this image, or if you are using your phone 
right now
 you can choose the 
Manual Settings
 option and copy and paste the information from the Linux section above:








Tap the plane icon on the top.


Accept the Android VPN connection warning.


You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






iOS


Unfortunately, support for Shadowsocks on iOS is terminated, and the app on AppStore is out-of-date. One alternative is:




Download a 
paid
 app 
Potatso
 and launch it. 


You will be prompted to sign into the iTunes Store the first time you run Potatso.


Tap the 
More
 icon in the lower-right of the screen.


Tap 
Import From QRCode
.


Use your phone to scan this image, or if you are using your phone 
right now
 you can manually add a new proxy from the 
Home
 tab and copy and paste the information from the Linux section above:








Enter a name when the 
Add a new proxy
 prompt appears, and tap 
OK
. You'll see a confirmation that the import was successful.


Tap the 
Home
 icon.


Tap 
Proxy
 and select the name of the proxy that you just imported.


Tap the blue 
Connect
 button.


If this is your first time running Potatso, iOS will ask you to verify that the application should have permission to add VPN configurations. Tap 
Allow
 and follow the instructions.






You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.
docs.title: ShadowSocks

docs.text: Platforms  Windows  OS X  Linux  Android  iOS
docs.title: Shadowsocks

docs.text: Method 1:   Download  Shadowsocks for Windows .  Extract the archive, and double-click on the Shadowsocks.exe file.  Make sure the QR code below is centered and completely visible, right-click on the Shadowsocks system tray icon, and go to  Servers     Scan QRCode from Screen...    Method 2:   You may also go to  Servers     New server  and manually complete the following steps:  Enter  178.62.33.140  as the  Server IP .  Enter  8388  as the  Server Port .  Enter  OpTBYD82WQzm29TZPgfJqA==  as the  Password .  The  Local Port  should be  1080  and the  Encryption Method  should be  aes-256-cfb .  Click  Save .    Click on the Shadowsocks menu tray icon and select  Enable .  That's it! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: Windows

docs.text: Method 1:   Download  ShadowsocksX .  Double-click the DMG, and drag the icon into your Applications folder.  Launch ShadowsocksX. You will be prompted to enter your password so that your system proxy settings can be modified.  Look for the Shadowsocks paper plane icon in your menu bar and click on it.  Make sure the QR code below is centered and completely visible, and choose  Scan QR Code from Screen...    Method 2:   You may also configure the connection by going to  Servers , selecting  Open Server Preferences... , and clicking the  +  button on the sidebar:  Enter  178.62.33.140  and  8388  in the  Address  fields.  Make sure  aes-256-cfb  is selected for the  Encryption  value.  Enter  OpTBYD82WQzm29TZPgfJqA==  as the  Password .  Click  OK .    Click on the Shadowsocks icon in the menu bar again, and choose  Global Mode .  You can use the Shadowsocks icon to enable/disable the VPN. The color of the icon will change based on whether or not it is active.  That's it! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: OS X

docs.text: Download the latest Shadowsocks  linux clients  for different Linux distributions.  From the command line, run  ss-qt5   Click  Connection , select  Add , and you can:   Make sure the QR code below is centered and completely visible, click on  Scan QR Code on Screnn      Or Choose  Manually , then fill in the configuration information as follows:   Server:  178.62.33.140  Port:  8388  Password:  OpTBYD82WQzm29TZPgfJqA==  Encryption Method:  aes-256-cfb       Once you have Shadowsocks running locally, you'll need to forward your browser traffic through the SOCKS proxy it provides.
docs.title: Linux

docs.text: Click the  Menu  button next to the  Home  icon to the right of the address bar.  Click  Options .  Click the  Advanced  icon.  Go to the  Network  tab.  Click the  Settings  button to  Configure how Firefox connects to the Internet .  Choose  Manual proxy configuration .  Enter  127.0.0.1  and Port  1080  on the  SOCKS Host  line.  Select  Remote DNS . This configures Firefox to send all DNS requests through the SOCKS proxy. This will protect you against DNS poisoning and ensure that false DNS entries cannot be used to censor your access.  Click  OK .  Click  OK  again to close the Firefox preferences window.  You should be good to go! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: Configuring Firefox to connect through a SOCKS proxy

docs.text: Download Shadowsocks for Android from  Google Play . If Google Play is blocked in your country, you can download a  latest release apk file  from Github.  Launch the application.  Tap the Shadowsocks icon in the top-left of the screen.  Tap the  +  icon in the bottom-right.  Select  Scan QR code .  Use your phone to scan this image, or if you are using your phone  right now  you can choose the  Manual Settings  option and copy and paste the information from the Linux section above:     Tap the plane icon on the top.  Accept the Android VPN connection warning.  You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: Android

docs.text: Unfortunately, support for Shadowsocks on iOS is terminated, and the app on AppStore is out-of-date. One alternative is:   Download a  paid  app  Potatso  and launch it.   You will be prompted to sign into the iTunes Store the first time you run Potatso.  Tap the  More  icon in the lower-right of the screen.  Tap  Import From QRCode .  Use your phone to scan this image, or if you are using your phone  right now  you can manually add a new proxy from the  Home  tab and copy and paste the information from the Linux section above:     Enter a name when the  Add a new proxy  prompt appears, and tap  OK . You'll see a confirmation that the import was successful.  Tap the  Home  icon.  Tap  Proxy  and select the name of the proxy that you just imported.  Tap the blue  Connect  button.  If this is your first time running Potatso, iOS will ask you to verify that the application should have permission to add VPN configurations. Tap  Allow  and follow the instructions.    You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: iOS

docs.text:
OpenVPN


For security reasons, OpenVPN clients typically have their own unique certificate and private key. The server you will be connecting to has been configured to allow clients to share the same certificate and private key, but you may still wish to give your phone and laptop different keys, for example.






Platforms


Windows


OS X


Linux


Linux (Ubuntu)


Android


iOS










Windows




Download and run a suitable 32-bit or 64-bit OpenVPN 
Windows Installer
.


Click 
Next
 and accept the license agreement by selecting 
I Agree
.


Click 
Next
 on the 
Choose Components
 screen. Leave all of the default options checked.


Make note of the Destination Folder. This is where you will place the 
databox
 client configuration profile after installation. Click 
Install
.


A Windows Security notice will appear and ask 
Would you like to install this device software?
. Click 
Install
.


Click 
Next
 on the 
Installation Complete
 screen.


Uncheck 
Show Readme
 and click 
Finish
.


Right-click on the OpenVPN GUI desktop icon and choose 
Properties
.


Go to the 
Compatibility
 tab and click the 
Run this program as an administrator
 checkbox in the 
Privilege Level
 section.


Double-click the OpenVPN GUI desktop icon to launch the application.


Download 
OpenVPN profile


Open the 
config
 directory that is located in the Destination Folder. For most users, this will either be in 
C:\Program Files\OpenVPN\config
 or 
C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenVPN\config
. You will see a single README file in this directory.


Drag and drop the downloaded 
databox
 file to this location alongside the README.


Right-click on the OpenVPN icon in your taskbar and choose 
Connect
.


You will see a log scroll by as the connection is established, followed by a taskbar notification indicating your assigned IP.


Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






OS X




Download and open 
Tunnelblick
.


Type your password to allow the installation process to complete, and click 
OK
.


Click 
Launch
 after the installation is finished.


Click 
I have configuration files
.


Download 
OpenVPN profile


Double-click the OpenVPN profile.


You will be asked to choose whether the profile should be available for all users or only the current user. After making your selection, you will be asked to enter your password.


Look for the Tunnelblick icon in your menu bar. Click on it, and choose 
Connect
.


Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






Linux




Install OpenVPN:




sudo apt-get install openvpn
 OR 
sudo yum install openvpn
 OR 
esoteric-package-manager hipster openvpn
 OR 
other platform
.




If installing OpenVPN via your package manager is not an option, you can also download and compile the 
OpenVPN source code
.


Download 
OpenVPN profile


Copy the downloaded 
databox
 file to the location of your choice. 
/etc/openvpn/
 is a decent option.


On some distributions, the pushed DHCP DNS option from the OpenVPN server will be ignored. This means that your DNS queries will still be routed through your ISP's servers which makes them vulnerable to what is known as a DNS leak.


You can test whether or not your DNS is leaking 
here
.


You can ensure that the correct DNS servers are used by adding the following lines to the top of the 
databox
 file:


script-security 2


up /etc/openvpn/update-resolv-conf


down /etc/openvpn/update-resolv-conf








Change direction to the profile location, execute OpenVPN, and pass it the .ovpn profile as an option: 
    
sudo openvpn databox






Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.








Android




Install 
OpenVPN for Android
.


Download 
OpenVPN profile


Copy the 
databox
 file to your phone.


Launch OpenVPN for Android.


Tap the folder icon in the lower-right of the screen.


Select the 
databox
 profile that you copied to your phone.


Tap the save icon (floppy disk) in the lower-right of the screen after the import is complete.


Tap the profile.


Accept the Android VPN connection warning.


Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.






iOS




Download 
OpenVPN Connect
 and launch it.


Download 
OpenVPN profile


Open iTunes on your computer and connect your phone.


Select your phone, click on the 
Apps
 tab, and find OpenVPN under the 
File Sharing
 section.


Drag and drop the downloaded 
databox
 file into the file sharing window.


OpenVPN on your phone will say that 
1 new OpenVPN profile is available for import
.


Tap the green 
+
 button to import the profile.


Tap the slider to connect to the OpenVPN server.


Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by 
looking up your IP address on Google
. It should say 
Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140
.

docs.text: For security reasons, OpenVPN clients typically have their own unique certificate and private key. The server you will be connecting to has been configured to allow clients to share the same certificate and private key, but you may still wish to give your phone and laptop different keys, for example. docs.title: OpenVPN

docs.text: Download and run a suitable 32-bit or 64-bit OpenVPN  Windows Installer .  Click  Next  and accept the license agreement by selecting  I Agree .  Click  Next  on the  Choose Components  screen. Leave all of the default options checked.  Make note of the Destination Folder. This is where you will place the  databox  client configuration profile after installation. Click  Install .  A Windows Security notice will appear and ask  Would you like to install this device software? . Click  Install .  Click  Next  on the  Installation Complete  screen.  Uncheck  Show Readme  and click  Finish .  Right-click on the OpenVPN GUI desktop icon and choose  Properties .  Go to the  Compatibility  tab and click the  Run this program as an administrator  checkbox in the  Privilege Level  section.  Double-click the OpenVPN GUI desktop icon to launch the application.  Download  OpenVPN profile  Open the  config  directory that is located in the Destination Folder. For most users, this will either be in  C:\Program Files\OpenVPN\config  or  C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenVPN\config . You will see a single README file in this directory.  Drag and drop the downloaded  databox  file to this location alongside the README.  Right-click on the OpenVPN icon in your taskbar and choose  Connect .  You will see a log scroll by as the connection is established, followed by a taskbar notification indicating your assigned IP.  Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .

Click  I have configuration files .  Download  OpenVPN profile  Double-click the OpenVPN profile.  You will be asked to choose whether the profile should be available for all users or only the current user. After making your selection, you will be asked to enter your password.  Look for the Tunnelblick icon in your menu bar. Click on it, and choose  Connect .  Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: OS X

docs.text:
Install OpenVPN:   sudo apt-get install openvpn  OR  sudo yum install openvpn  OR  esoteric-package-manager hipster openvpn  OR  other platform .   If installing OpenVPN via your package manager is not an option, you can also download and compile the  OpenVPN source code .  Download  OpenVPN profile  Copy the downloaded  databox  file to the location of your choice.  /etc/openvpn/  is a decent option.  On some distributions, the pushed DHCP DNS option from the OpenVPN server will be ignored. This means that your DNS queries will still be routed through your ISP's servers which makes them vulnerable to what is known as a DNS leak.  You can test whether or not your DNS is leaking  here .  You can ensure that the correct DNS servers are used by adding the following lines to the top of the  databox  file:  script-security 2  up /etc/openvpn/update-resolv-conf  down /etc/openvpn/update-resolv-conf     Change direction to the profile location, execute OpenVPN, and pass it the .ovpn profile as an option: 
     sudo openvpn databox    Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: Linux

docs.text: Install  OpenVPN for Android .  Download  OpenVPN profile  Copy the  databox  file to your phone.  Launch OpenVPN for Android.  Tap the folder icon in the lower-right of the screen.  Select the  databox  profile that you copied to your phone.  Tap the save icon (floppy disk) in the lower-right of the screen after the import is complete.  Tap the profile.  Accept the Android VPN connection warning.  Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: Android

docs.text: Download  OpenVPN Connect  and launch it.  Download  OpenVPN profile  Open iTunes on your computer and connect your phone.  Select your phone, click on the  Apps  tab, and find OpenVPN under the  File Sharing  section.  Drag and drop the downloaded  databox  file into the file sharing window.  OpenVPN on your phone will say that  1 new OpenVPN profile is available for import .  Tap the green  +  button to import the profile.  Tap the slider to connect to the OpenVPN server.  Success! You can verify that your traffic is being routed properly by  looking up your IP address on Google . It should say  Your public IP address is 178.62.33.140 .
docs.title: iOS
